channel.title: Running server in an applet - How?
channel.description: I think the title explains itself, but I need to know how to put a server into a webpage. I don't know whether it's been done, but if it has, can someone tell me how? :)

item.description:

item.description:

I’m going to fit them into a JAR file and sign it and then see what happens.[br][size=1]Posted on: January 13, 2007, 05:00:07 PM[/size][hr]Keystore is missing! x.x

I must be being dumb today. Anyone care to help?

item.source: Running server in an applet - How?

item.title: Running server in an applet - How?
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

Hikaru:

I had a problem with the reading of files,

Javacisnotrecognized:

Well, first you need to know how to use jarsigner, keytool, and appletviewer

Do you think the Sun corporation would just let any random website that happened to have an applet let them access the users filesystem and then read/delete all their files? Applets can’t read files, make sockets (Except to the site that runs the applet on it), make serversockets, or even invoke Shutdown.halt(int) unless they have been given security permissions by the user. Learn how to use jarsigner for fuck sake.

Read full topic
item.source: Running server in an applet - How?

item.title: Running server in an applet - How?
item.dc:creator: @Hikaru Hikaru
item.description:
@Hikaru wrote:

Well, first you need to know how to use jarsigner, keytool, and appletviewer, then basically edit your servers server.java thing to start like

Code:
public class server extends java.applet.Applet {
and put this method in there …

Code:
public void init(){
main(null);
}

Then the rest is simple HTML.

I had a problem with the reading of files, but then again I suppose I should upload it to a server now ^^;

And wtf!
I can hardly get on the forums because of this stupid “Cannot load Database” error >_>

Read full topic
